question: Rummindei Pillar Inscription which talks about taxation in Maurya era has been found at which of the following places?
explanation: Lumbini Pillar Edict in Nepal is known as the Rummindei Pillar Inscription .The Lumbini Pillar Edict recorded that sometime after the twentieth year of his reign, Ashoka travelled to the Buddha's birthplace and personally made offerings. He then had a stone pillar set up and reduced the taxes of the people in that area.
